description: Number of bracelets (turn over necklaces) of n beads of 2 colors, 9 of them black.
comments: From Vladimir Shevelev, Apr 23 2011 (Start)Also number of non-equivalent necklaces of 9 beads each of them painted by one of n colors.The sequence solves the so-called Reis problem about convex k-gons in case k=9 (see our comment to A032279).(End)
references: H. Gupta, Enumeration of incongruent cyclic k-gons, Indian J. Pure and Appl. Math., 10 (1979), no.8, 964-999.
V. Shevelev, Necklaces and convex k-gons, Indian J. Pure and Appl. Math., 35 (2004), no. 5, 629-638.
links: F. Ruskey, Necklaces, Lyndon words, De Bruijn sequences, etc.
V. Shevelev,Spectrum of permanent's values and its extremal magnitudes in Lambda_n^3 and Lambda_n(alpha,beta,gamma)(Cf. Section 5)
Index entries for sequences related to bracelets
mathematica: k = 9; Table[(Apply[Plus, Map[EulerPhi[ # ]Binomial[n/#, k/# ] &, Divisors[GCD[n, k]]]]/n + Binomial[If[OddQ[n], n - 1, n - If[OddQ[k], 2, 0]]/2, If[OddQ[k], k - 1, k]/2])/2, {n, k, 50}] - _Robert A. Russell_, Sep 27 2004
author: _Christian G. Bower_
